title: Question 22
prompt: The purpose of the questions at the end of the passage is to
feedback: The correct answer is to 'anticipate counter-arguments that justify indifference.'  The speaker asks several questions at the end of the speech, which suggest that he is anticipating counter-arguments that justify indifference.  He asks, 'Can one possibly view indifference as a virtue? Is it necessary at times to practice it simply to keep one's sanity, live normally, enjoy a fine meal and a glass of wine, as the world around us experiences harrowing upheavals?'  The incorrect choices do not state the purpose of the questions.
